intro: Geostachys annamensis, commonly known as Annam's geostachys, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
